trait.name: Description
trait.text:
Minotaurs are barrel-chested humanoids with heads resembling those of bulls. Their horns range in size from about 1 foot long to great, curling weapons easily three times that length. They often ornament their horns with metal rings or sheathe them in metal to protect them from damage.
Source: Unearthed Arcana: Waterborne Adventures p. 1

trait.name: Age
trait.text: Minotaurs enter adulthood at around the age of 17 and can live up to 150 years.

trait.name: Alignment
trait.text: Minotaurs believe in a strict code of honor, and thus tend toward law. They are loyal to the death and make implacable enemies, even as their brutal culture and disdain for weakness push them toward evil.

trait.name: Size
trait.text:
Minotaurs typically stand well over 6 feet tall and weigh an average of 300 pounds. Your size is Medium.

trait.name: Conqueror's Virtue
trait.text: From a young age, you focused on one of the three virtues of strength, cunning, or intellect. Your choice of your Strength, Intelligence, or Wisdom score increases by 1.

trait.name: Horns
trait.text: You are never unarmed. You are proficient with your horns, which are a melee weapon that deals 1d10 piercing damage. Your horns grant you advantage on all checks made to shove a creature, but not to avoid being shoved yourself.

trait.name: Goring Rush
trait.text: When you use the Dash action during your turn, you can make a melee attack with your horns as a bonus action.

trait.name: Hammering Horns
trait.text: When you use the Attack action during your turn to make a melee attack, you can attempt to shove a creature with your horns as a bonus action. You cannot use this shove attempt to knock a creature prone.

trait.name: Labyrinthine Recall
trait.text: You can perfectly recall any path you have traveled.

trait.name: Sea Reaver
trait.text: You gain proficiency with navigator's tools and vehicles (water).

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Common.
